jid-validate &flow;
0.0.1 2019-09-06 psa
First draft.

section1.p: Usefull to test the PRECIS / JID enforcement implementation of XMPP services.

If the JID is valid, then a <jid-validate-result/> with a <valid-jid/> child element is returned. The valid-jid element MUST contain 'domainpart' and may contain 'localpart' and/or 'resourcepart' elements. If the JID does not contain a local- or resourcepart, then the element is omitted.
section1.example: <iq type='result' from='user@example.org/resource' to='example.org' id='request2'> <jid-validate-result xmlns='urn:xmpp:jid-validate:0'> <invalid-jid> <reason>Invalid codepoint 'Ⅳ' in localpart.</reason> </invalid-jid> </jid-validate-result> </iq>

section1.p: TODO: Consider restricting access to serivce, e.g. to local or admin users only, or rate limit it.
